III. Member of a scientific advisory entity
Nationaal Fonds voor Wetenschappelijk onderzoek (NFWO), National Council for Scientific Research, Brussels, BELGIUM

Member of a the FWO-Med8 Panel Health Sciences: two to three meetings a year. The Nationaal Fonds voor Wetenschappelijk onderzoek (FWO) is a Public Utility Foundation funding fundamental research, see http://www.fwo.be/en/the-fwo/ In the Panel meetings, scientific projects that the members evaluated beforehand, are discussed and ranked. A member evaluates about 30 projects a year.
III. Member of a scientific advisory entity
FASFC & Sci Com- FASFC, Belgian Federal Agency for the Safety of the Food Chain and Scientific Committee of the Federal Agency for the Safety of the Food Chain, BELGIUM, Brussels

Member of the Scientific Committee of the Belgian Federal Agency of Food Safety Scientific Council. The Scientific Committee has a central role in the assessment of the risks in terms of the food chain. It consists of scientists who specialize in this field. If necessary, it can be relied on a network of experts when very specific problems arise. This function requires monthly plenary sessions. In these sessions the members discuss scientific questions of importance to the Agency and provide advice to the Agency. Furthermore, for specific questions, the members participate in small work-groups, on an ad-hoc basis.

Academic Environment - Teaching in the faculty of public health and the faculty of medicine (Université catholique de Louvain) - Research and PhD supervision. Subject: developing and applying analytical tools assisting in better understanding vector-borne diseases & zoonoses. - Service to the society
Evaluator of Research funding applications of the Romanian - EEA Research Programme
